In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's the implementation of the `wrap_string` function in Julia:
```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width = 10)
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""
    
    for word in split(String, text), keep=true)
        if (length(current_line) + length(word)) <= text_width
            current_line *= " " * word
        else
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        end
    end
    
    if !isempty(current_line)
        push!(lines, current_line)
    end
    
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```
Example usage:
```julia
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed nec ultrices est."
formatted_text = wrap_string(text)
println(formatted_text)
```
This will output a wrapped text with line breaks to maintain the `text_width`.
